snippet: No candidate today is as daring as Herman Cain when it comes to charming an audience with silky silliness, but not all of Mr. Cain’s attempts at comedy succeed.
abstract: Herman Cain's humor distinguishes him from rivals in hunt for Republican presidential nomination, but not all of his attempts at comedy succeed.

headline.main: Behind Cain’s Humor, a Question of Seriousness
headline.print_headline: Behind Cain’s Humor, a Question of Seriousness

snippet: The following is a transcript of the Republican presidential debate in Las Vegas, Nev.

headline.main: Western Republican Leadership Conference (WRLC)/CNN Debate at the Venetian Resort Hotel Casino

snippet: Analysts were disappointed on Tuesday when Research in Motion unveiled little more than a rebranding of what it called its “next generation platform.”
abstract: Research in Motion disappoints investors and analysts after unveiling little more than a rebranding of what it called its 'next generation platform' for BlackBerry smartphones and tablets at conference intended to persuade app developers to produce software for future devices.

headline.main: RIM Unveils an Upgrade, but Little Else
headline.print_headline: RIM Unveils an Upgrade, but Little Else

snippet: Sony, maker of the PSP, will make another portable game device, the Vita.
abstract: Sony, maker of the PSP, will make another portable game device, the Vita.

snippet: Companies in California are resuscitating the domestic olive oil industry, producing oils that can be fresher, purer and cheaper than all but the finest imports.
abstract: California companies have mounted a major new effort to produce olive oils that can be fresher, purer and cheaper than all but the finest imports.

snippet: The company said iPhone sales fell in the quarter because of widespread rumors that a new phone would be released, delaying consumer purchases.
abstract: Apple, in rare disappointment, misses Wall Street forecasts but still reports a 54 percent increase in profit and a 39 percent jump in revenue for its fourth-quarter results; company blames lackluster iPhone sales due to widespread rumors that a new phone would be released; profit was $6.62 billion, or $7.05 a share, on revenue of $28.27 billion.

headline.main: Apple’s Profit Gains 54%, but iPhone Sales Fall Short of Expectations
headline.print_headline: Apple’s Profit Gains 54%, but iPhone Sales Fall Short of Expectations

snippet: The chef demonstrates how to best sharpen a knife, chop an onion and make an omelet.
abstract: Chef Jacques Pepin demonstrates how to best sharpen a knife, chop garlic and make an omelet; Pepin's 26th cookbook Essential Pepin gathers together hit recipes from the arc of his career; two of Pepin's recipes provided.

headline.main: There’s the Wrong Way and Jacques Pépin’s Way
headline.print_headline: There’s the Wrong Way and His Way
